name: .help
description: Show this help.
vignettes: Show the list of command-line options of [1mcrace-plot[0m.

name: .man
description: Show details of the selected option.
vignettes: Show details of the selected option. call with [1mpython crace --man [option][0m

name: .version
description: Show the version of crace-plot.
vignettes: Show the version of [1mcrace-plot[0m.

name: execDir
description: Directory where crace results are from.
vignettes: Directory where crace results are from. [1mrace_log[0m must be included in this directory.

name: outDir
description: Directory where the output files will be.
vignettes:
Directory where the crace plot outputs will be in. The default output directory is the current directory.
 The output directory can be created automatically before executing [1mcrace-plot[0m.

name: title
description: The title of the output plot.
vignettes:
The title of the output plot. The default value of this option depends on parameters [1mexecDir[0m and [1mdrawMethod[0m.
 This option is only avaliable when these two parameters are not None.

name: fileName
description: The name of the output plot file.
vignettes:
The name of the output plot file. The default value of this option is 'plot.png'. This option is only 
avaliable when parameters [1mexecDir[0m and [1mdrawMethod[0m are not None.

name: drawMethod
domain: (boxplot, violinplot, parallelcoord, parallelcat, piechart, pairplot, histplot, jointplot, heatmap)
description: The method chose to draw a plot for the Crace results.
vignettes:
The funtion chose to analyse the [1mCrace results[0m. If this option is not null, [1mexecDir[0m must to be provided.
 When one method is chosen, the correspoding option must be True.

name: dataType
domain: (e, exp, exps, experiments, c, config, configs, configurations)
description: The origin of data used for drawing plot(s).
vignettes:
What type of the data used for drawing plot(s), which includes the experiments of configurations on instances from
 training or test and the details of configurations.

name: numConfigurations
description: The number of configurations used to draw plot.
vignettes: The number of configurations used to draw plot. The default number is the length of final returned elite configurations.

name: configurations
description: The configurations used to draw plot.
vignettes: The configurations used to draw plot.

name: training
description: Enable/disable to load crace data from the training part.
vignettes: Enable/disable to load crace data from the training part.

name: test
description: Enable/disable to load crace data from the test part.
vignettes: Enable/disable to load crace data from the test part.

name: digits
description: Maximum number of decimal places that are significant for experiment results.
vignettes: Maximum number of decimal places that are significant for experiment results.

name: keyParameter
description: The parameter chosed to be the key when drawing parallelcoord, pairplot.
vignettes: The parameter chosed to be the key one shown in the plot. For example: if one parameter is provided as the key for the parallelplot, the plot will be grouped by this parameter.

name: multiParameters
description: Multiple parameters provided to draw plot like scatter matrix.
vignettes: Multiple parameters provided to draw plot like scatter matrix on the provided Crace results.

name: dpi
description: The parameter dpi used for saving plot.
vignettes: When method used to draw a plot will export a plot file, this parameter will be added to control the quality of the exported plot.

name: size
domain: (s, m, l, small, midium, mid, large)
description: The parameter dpi used for saving plot.
vignettes: When method used to draw a plot will export a plot file, this parameter will be added to control the quality of the exported plot.

name: showfliers
description: The parameter showfliers used for saving plot.
vignettes: Enable/disable showfliers when drawing the picture.

name: statisticalTest
description: Add p-values for plots or not.
vignettes: Enable/disable add p-values when drawing the plot.
